toc_entry.title: Back Home
toc_entry.description: Every Texan gets the urge to leave. But then, every Texan eventually wants to come back again.

toc_entry.title: Life With the Sutherlands, Frontier Family
toc_entry.description: Outside the back door stretches the lonely prairie; there is deep silence broken sometimes by gunshots and things that go bump in the night. But here on the edge of Dallas’s suburbs, you can always retreat to the whirlpool in the bathroom.

toc_entry.title: Trial By Technicality
toc_entry.description: The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals confirms your worst fears about lawyers and judges and the impotence of the criminal justice system.

toc_entry.title: How Farrah Fawcett Changed the World
toc_entry.description: It was simple, really. With Charlie’s Angels, television discovered sex.

toc_entry.title: The Tornado
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: The air is muggy, the sky turns an eerie green, then you hear a sound like a fleet of freight trains. Beware, Texas, it’s that time of year again.

toc_entry.title: The Architects
toc_entry.description: Welcome to Houston, the cutting edge of architecture. The local boys are turning a gentlemen’s profession into a business, the stylish out-of-towners are creating a new aesthetic, and neither group is filled with admiration for the other.

toc_entry.title: Bad Water
toc_entry.subtitle: Environment
toc_entry.description: Everyone agrees that clear, blue Barton Springs has always set Austin apart from other Texas cities. Unfortunately, it’s now polluted.

toc_entry.title: Meanwhile, Back In GIDDInGS
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: Texas’ hottest oil patch is cooling down.

toc_entry.title: Border Machismo
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Jack Nicholson is looking for his angel of redemption in The Border. In Personal Best, Victor/Victoria, and Making Love, everyone is looking for anyone but a member of the opposite sex.

toc_entry.title: Jazz Mastered
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: The greatness of Paul Desmond, the staying power of Art Blakey, the de-fusion of Stan Getz—all these are on record, and more.

toc_entry.title: A Flourishing Bride Of Christ
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: El Paso’s Ysleta Mission, the oldest church in Texas, is also one of the liveliest; what Houston Christian Scientists lack in testimonial passion they make up for in selfpossession.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The countdown begins in the Dallas newspaper fight; Victor Garza is going your way-if you’re going to Laredo; one of Houston’s legal monoliths cracks; Clements has a lukewarm record, but the Democratic challengers aren't so hot, either.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: The New Federalism gets the old raspberry; will Jim Baker run the country or the bank?; a political test for Texas labor; a law Houston’s new police chief would love to break.
